properties.name: dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.enabled
properties.description: If enabled, will provide an auto-configuration that will by default registered the Scalar Extensions available in graphql-java-extended-scalars for the DGS Framework.

properties.name: dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.time-dates.enabled
properties.description: Enabled by default, if dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.enabled is enabled, will register the DateTime, Date, and Time scalar extensions.

properties.name: dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.objects.enabled
properties.description: Enabled by default, if dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.enabled is enabled, will register the Object, Json, Url, and Locale scalar extensions.

properties.name: dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.numbers.enabled
properties.description: Enabled by default, will register all numeric scalar extensions such as PositiveInt, NegativeInt, etc.

properties.name: dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.numbers.bigdecimal.enabled
properties.description: Enabled by default, can be used to disable the BigDecimal scalar; it requires dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.numbers.enabled to be enabled as well.

properties.name: dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.numbers.biginteger.enabled
properties.description: Enabled by default, can be used to disable the BigInteger scalar; it requires dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.numbers.enabled to be enabled as well.

properties.name: dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.chars.enabled
properties.description: Enabled by default, if dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.enabled is enabled, will register the GraphQLChar extension.

properties.name: dgs.graphql.extensions.scalars.strict-mode.enabled
properties.description: Enables strict mode for scalar extensions; this will throw an exception if the scalar type is already registered.
